etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Mineralogy Magazine. From Swedish celsian from the name of Anders Celsius + -an

definitions: A colourless, white, or pale yellow mineral of the monoclinic crystal system which is a barium-containing feldspar, BaAl₂ Si₂ O₈, dimorphous with paracelsian and occurring mostly in association with manganese deposits.
